ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: In social situations, I have the ability to alter my behavior if I feel that something else is called for.
Notes: 0=Certainly, always false; 1=Generally false; 2=Somewhat false, but with exceptions; 3=Somewhat true, but with exceptions; 4=Generally true; 5=Certainly, always true

ElementDescription: I am often able to read people's true emotions correctly through their eyes.
Notes: 0=Certainly, always false; 1=Generally false; 2=Somewhat false, but with exceptions; 3=Somewhat true, but with exceptions; 4=Generally true; 5=Certainly, always true

ElementDescription: I have the ability to control the way I come across to people, depending on the impression I wish to give them.
Notes: 0=Certainly, always false; 1=Generally false; 2=Somewhat false, but with exceptions; 3=Somewhat true, but with exceptions; 4=Generally true; 5=Certainly, always true

ElementDescription: In conversations, I am sensitive to even the slightest change in the facial expression of the person I am conversing with.
Notes: 0=Certainly, always false; 1=Generally false; 2=Somewhat false, but with exceptions; 3=Somewhat true, but with exceptions; 4=Generally true; 5=Certainly, always true

ElementDescription: My powers of intuition are quite good when it comes to understand others' emotions and motives. (7 point scale)
Notes: 0=Certainly, always false; 1=Generally false; 2=Somewhat false, but with exceptions; 3=Somewhat true, but with exceptions; 4=Generally true; 5=Certainly, always true

ElementDescription: I can usually tell when others consider a joke to be in bad taste, even though they may laugh convincingly.
Notes: 0=Certainly, always false; 1=Generally false; 2=Somewhat false, but with exceptions; 3=Somewhat true, but with exceptions; 4=Generally true; 5=Certainly, always true

ElementDescription: When I feel that the image I am portraying isn't working, I can readily change it to something that does.
Notes: 0=Certainly, always false; 1=Generally false; 2=Somewhat false, but with exceptions; 3=Somewhat true, but with exceptions; 4=Generally true; 5=Certainly, always true

ElementDescription: I can usually tell when I've said something inappropriate by reading it in the listener's eyes.
Notes: 0=Certainly, always false; 1=Generally false; 2=Somewhat false, but with exceptions; 3=Somewhat true, but with exceptions; 4=Generally true; 5=Certainly, always true

ElementDescription: I have trouble changing my behavior to suit different people and different situations. - RESPONSE
Notes: Item is reverse scored, use this element to indicate the response. 0=Certainly, always false; 1=Generally false; 2=Somewhat false, but with exceptions; 3=Somewhat true, but with exceptions; 4=Generally true; 5=Certainly, always true

ElementDescription: I have trouble changing my behavior to suit different people and different situations. - SCORE
Notes: Item is reverse scored, use this element to indicate the score.

ElementDescription: I have found that I can adjust my behavior to meet the requirements of any situation I find myself in.
Notes: 0=Certainly, always false; 1=Generally false; 2=Somewhat false, but with exceptions; 3=Somewhat true, but with exceptions; 4=Generally true; 5=Certainly, always true

ElementDescription: If someone is lying to me, I usually know it at once from that person's manner of expression.
Notes: 0=Certainly, always false; 1=Generally false; 2=Somewhat false, but with exceptions; 3=Somewhat true, but with exceptions; 4=Generally true; 5=Certainly, always true

ElementDescription: Even when it might be to my advantage, I have difficulty putting up a good front. - RESPONSE
Notes: Item is reverse scored, use this element to indicate the response. 0=Certainly, always false; 1=Generally false; 2=Somewhat false, but with exceptions; 3=Somewhat true, but with exceptions; 4=Generally true; 5=Certainly, always true

ElementDescription: Even when it might be to my advantage, I have difficulty putting up a good front. - SCORE
Notes: Item is reverse scored, use this element to indicate the score.

ElementDescription: Once I know that the situation calls for, it's easy for me to regulate my actions accordingly.
Notes: 0=Certainly, always false; 1=Generally false; 2=Somewhat false, but with exceptions; 3=Somewhat true, but with exceptions; 4=Generally true; 5=Certainly, always true

ElementDescription: Ability to Modify Self-presentation Score
Notes: Sum of scores from items 1, 3, 7, 9, 10, 12, 13

ElementDescription: Sensitivity to Expressive Behavior of Others Score
Notes: Sum of scores from items 2, 4, 5, 6, 8, 11

ElementDescription: RSMS Total Score
Notes: Sum of scores from items 1-13

Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly Agree; -99=NA
